key_channel_insights.line_content: Parity outside the U.S. collapsed to 54%, driving most of the OTA mis-alignment and exposing margin risk in international points of sale.
Metasearch remains best-aligned at 98.9% parity; exposure is limited to Non-US origins where 3.2% of fares price higher and offer-absence is climbing.
Over half (56%) of GDS itineraries price above AA.com, peaking at 70% for far-out bookings and potentially eroding early-purchase demand.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: Overall OTA parity stayed high at 91% despite a 1.1-pt week-over-week dip.
Non-US origins show only 54% parity and 39% OTA-higher cases, signaling urgent remediation needs.
‘Offer not found’ reached 3.4% in the 0-7-day window, up 1.7 pts week-over-week and risking last-minute sales.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Offers absent on OTAs affect 2.7% of OD pairs (+1.2 pts WoW), slightly above last month.
Price parity remains strong at 91.0%, slipping only 0.1 pt month-on-month.
4.3% of itineraries price higher on OTAs, carrying a modest +0.15% premium.
Discounted OTA fares fell to 2.0% (−0.14 pt WoW) with a minimal −0.10% undercut.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: Parity stronger at 94.5% with only 1.9% OTA-higher, yet ‘not found’ doubled to 2.0%.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Healthy 95.4% parity; OTA-higher nearly negligible at 0.3%; offer absence 2.1%.
Parity drops to 53.5%; 38.6% OTA-higher and 7.6% missing offers—primary driver of OTA variance.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Parity softens to 89.5%; ‘not found’ peaks at 3.4% (+1.7 pts WoW).
Robust 94.2% parity; OTA-higher stable at 4.3% with +0.17% premium.

mse_highlights.line_content: Metasearch checks show near-perfect alignment, flat month-on-month.
Parity for Non-US origins dips to 95.1% with 3.2% MSE-higher fares.
‘Offer not found’ for 60+-day bookings rose to 0.67% (+0.43 pt WoW).

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Only 0.35% of searches return no MSE offer, though trending upward (+0.04 pt WoW).
Price parity stands at 98.9% (−0.19 pt WoW, +0.60 pt MoM).
0.50% of itineraries price higher on MSE with a +0.23% premium, concentrated in Non-US & far-out segments.
Undercutting limited to 0.22% of checks (−0.24% average discount).

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: Parity 99.3%; MSE premiums larger (+0.43%) but appear in just 0.18% of checks.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Parity slips to 95.1%; 3.2% MSE-higher and 1.6% missing offers.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Offer absence climbed to 0.67%; parity edged down to 98.8%.

gds_highlights.line_content: Majority of GDS fares priced above AA.com; under-pricing virtually absent.
Average premium only +0.26%, indicating tactical rather than structural mis-pricing.
70% of far-out fares higher in GDS with a +0.32% premium, threatening early demand capture.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Higher-priced cases at 56.2% (+0.7 pp WoW); premium steady at +0.26%.
Parity holds 43.4% of itineraries, down 0.7 pp WoW.
Discounts negligible at 0.12% frequency with −0.13% average undercut.
Missing offers minimal at 0.27%, improving 0.54 pp month-over-month.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: 68% higher-priced but softer +0.14% premium; parity erodes to 29%.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Balanced split: 49% higher vs 50% parity; +0.22% premium.
70% higher-priced with the steepest +0.32% premium; parity only 30%.
